61625.description: The game is a trivia game which also includes a large block of wood, a hammer and some nails. The active player rolls a die to determine a category of question (skip the trivia part on a roll of 6). When the player can answer the question asked, he or she can hit his or her nail (which is in the block of wood) with the hammer once. The first player whose nail is completely inside the wood is the winner.
61625.name: Hammer iT

53436.description:
Epidemic pits two players controlling a group of friends against a third player who controls a monster.

From the site:
"It's the middle of the night and you and your friends in a haunted house. You are trapped inside and your only way out is by killing the monster before he kills you."
53436.name: Monster House

53438.description:
This game is a Groovy Girls version of classic Bingo with a few differences; instead of numbers the cards are filled with various Groovy Girl characters, and a deck of cards with the characters are used as call outs instead of numbered balls.  The first person to complete a row wins!

Contents in special metal box:
-4 double sided Bingo cards (4x4) grid
-32 call out cards
-44 markers
-Game Rules
53438.name: Groovy Girls Bingo

61635.description:
The game is played on a 6x6 board which is divided into 9 2x2 squares. On these, tiles are placed which have numbers 1-6 or are empty. One side is white, the other black. The two players take turn placing the tiles which have to connect to other tiles of their color and have to fit into the rows and columns sudoku-style. The aim is to fill as many rows, columns and squares with one's own color.

There are some other variants of the game in which other player's tiles can be enclosed and turned around (to one's own side), for example.
61635.name: Dominari

61640.description:
Chess³ (ChessCubed) is a three-player take on Chess, set on a hexagonal board.  The concept of three-player chess is nothing new (e.g. 3 Man Chess, Chess for Three, Three Player Chess, Trigon Chess & Checkers, Tri-Chess, Megachess, 3er Schach), and the concept of chess on a hexagonal board is nothing new (e.g. Hexes Chess, Hexagonal Chess, En Garde!, etc.).  Heck, the concept of three-player chess on a hexagonal board isn't even new (e.g. Hexagonal Chess for three), but there are several features of Chess³ that make it stand out:


     It emulates the traditional, two-rank setup with a straight line of powerful pieces protected by a straight line of pawns.
     The hexagonal playfield has an incredible 168 hexes in order to accommodate each player's army.
     Each player has the eight traditional power pieces, plus a champion.  (The champion is the popular bishop/knight compound, but obviously with a hexagonal definition.)
     Each player has ten pawns to protect the nine power pieces from wall to wall.
     It features an angular, but familiar redesign of the pieces, each of which bears a hexagonal base.


The game is designed to be portable, with a roll-up board, a drawstring bag for each player's pieces, and a courier tube of a case for the whole thing.
61640.name: Chess³

61653.description:
STORY

Beloved King Lonelyheart has been murdered, and as he had no heirs to the throne, you and the other royal advisors are squarely out of a job. But fear not! Six candidates are rallying for the position, and the one the people find most favorable will be elected. The question is, which ones will you kiss up to and which ones will you denounce? Your choice in playing will determine how wise (and crafty) you really are. The wisest player will be selected as the new ruler's first advisor and will win the game.

				
					OBJECTIVE

Each turn players will gain inside information on one of the six candidates. Players will then be approached with opportunities to praise or denounce candidates. Players want to praise the candidate they believe will be the winner of the election, and denounce the candidates who they think will lose. At the end of the game, the candidates will be ranked, and the player's score will be based on what they have said about each candidate, along with the candidate's final position. The player with the highest score wins.
61653.name: Courtier

61654.description:
24 hours ago, your quiet, unassuming little town was struck by a plague that turned ordinary citizens into brain eating zombies.  As the last handful of uninfected survivors, your job is to gather the three mementos that are most precious to you, team up with other survivors, and escape town - all without having your brain eaten by zombies.

Room Full of Zombies is a party game for 12 to 20 players.
61654.name: Room Full of Zombies: Party Edition

61655.description:
Box says An intriguing fun and educational game for 2 or more players or teams. 
It is an Aussie version of Trivial Persuit I suppose.
Proudly printed in Australia.
Created and manufactured by J.P.P Productions 18 Tregear Street. Moonah. Tasmania. 7009
61655.name: Aussie-Trivia

61664.description:
Erzähl doch mal... is a story telling game in which the players try to use their picture cards to tell a story with the elements in the pictures. The game requires creativity, as players have to figure out a way to implement the new cards in the story. The game also requires concentration and memory, because the players have to remember the whole story in correct order, as they have to recite the whole thing from beginning to end, every time a card is added.

If a player makes a mistake - forgets something, tells things in wrong order - the card they drew is removed from the game. That element won't join the story. It also means a loss of a point, as the number of cards collected during the game determines the winner.

A little wooden cat moves forward on a track towards a castle which marks the end of the game. Some spaces on the track have special effects that remove cards from play or exchange them, changing the story. Some spaces let you draw a card, but the next player has to tell the story.
61664.name: Erzähl doch mal...

61665.description: Four "flocks" of sheep (two sheep per player) move onto a meadow, trying to find the juiciest grass. There is also a shepherd dog which influences the moves. A sun disk moves around the game board; when the day is over, the sheep which ate the juiciest grass are the winners.
61665.name: Schafe scheuchen

61667.description:
Arenario is a themed rummy game where players train gladiators, and send them out to fight in the arena.

Melds consist of cards representing a gladiator, a weapon, and a defence; and gladiators can progress through three different arenas of varying difficulty.

Arenario has been created for the Themed Rummy design contest.
61667.name: Arenario

61671.description:
Napoleon’s Legacy is a set of rules allowing players to game warfare during the period 1795 to 1865, taking in the Napoleonic Wars to the American Civil War.

The rules arose from the collective fascination for the variety of conflicts during this period of history shared by the writing and testing team. We also felt that there was a need for a faster playing set of rules for the period that kept charts and calculations to a bare minimum. Legacy is a flowing game, with the element of surprise and frustration built in to simulate the Fog-of-War using commands issued by dice rolls.

The core rules apply to all the conflicts during the period. You will find that the battle tactics used by the warring nations throughout the period covered by these rules were taught to all officers under the huge shadow cast by Napoleon. With the army lists provided towards the back of the book there are additional rules for the conflicts in which these armies took part.

Napoleonic doctrine would be present at every battle to 1865 and the end of the American Civil War: Johnny Reb and Billy Yank were part of Napoleon’s Legacy…. As are you, as you play this game!
61671.name: Napoleon's Legacy

53482.description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

I created this card game for younger children, but when different people started playing with them, we found out that teenagers and adults laughed uncontrollably as they tried to shout out the right animal sounds!

This game is made out of laminated paper (with rounded corners). Rules: Cards are placed down one at a time. Two players see who can make the correct animal sound first. The person who makes the correct sound first, holds on to the card. When the rabbit card appears - don't make a sound! If you do - you lose one of your cards. It helps to have a judge, too, to determine who shouts out the right sound first. Whoever ends up with the most cards in the end wins.
53482.name: Baa Baa Moo

61677.description:
West of the Dauphiné Alps, the Vercors Plateau forms a 3,000 feet high natural fortress with limited access to the outside world. Following the invasion of France’s Zone Libre by German and Italian armies, elements of the now disbanded Army of the Armistice found in Vercors the perfect base of operations from which to continue harassing the German occupier and its despised ally, the French Milice…

So begins the background to the Vercors Campaign - five new scenarios created by Jacques “jdrommel” David that highlight the heroic Maquisards of the French Resistance and their battle against overwhelming SS forces on the Vercors Plateau in the summer of 1944. As with all Memoir ‘44 Campaigns, victory is earned over multiple battles with the outcome of each scenario determining the circumstances of the next.
61677.name: Memoir '44: The Vercors Campaign

61679.description:
Air Battles Over Korea June 25, 1950 - July 27, 1953

Check your 6! -  Jet Korea: is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. This book contains historical scenarios for recreating the aerial campaign over Korea from June 1950 to July 1953 that can be played individually or linked to form a single campaign.

HISTORICAL RESEARCH: This book includes several introduction sections containing campaign historical background, plus a biblography for further reading.
61679.name: Check Your 6! Air War Korea

61691.description:
Låna mig en femma [swedish] - Lend me a fiver

Each player puts 2 chips in the bank. There are 55 cards in the deck. Some cards are marked with coins. Each player draws such valuecards to the total value of 15 Swedish kronor. You win when you have the amount of 20 SEK. There are some special cards like:

The king: The player drawing this card gets a coin from each other player. Text on the card (translated from Swedish): I have only "a crown" [the Swedish currency is 'kronor' (crowns)] on me, as every majesty. And I need i myself, as you must understand.

The bursar: If you take this card, you win the game! Text on the card (translated from Swedish): "As to borrow money from my counter, you must know that I as a deposit must have a first-rate caution."

You must have exactly 20 SEK to win the game!
61691.name: Låna mig en femma!

expansions.name: Xtreme Global 1940 Xpansion Mod  (fan expansion for Axis & Allies Europe 1940)

61692.description:
Axis & Allies Europe 1940, a deluxe edition of Axis & Allies: Europe, includes neutral countries which can be invaded. There are true neutrals as well as pro-axis and pro-allied neutrals. Mechanized infantry and tactical bombers are included. Mechanized infantry is represented by half-tracks. France (blue) and Italy (brown) have national tokens and dedicated units of their own. The board measures 35 inches wide by 32 inches high (89 x 81 cm).

This game is designed to be joined with Axis & Allies Pacific 1940 to create a six-player game on a map measuring 70 inches wide by 32 inches high (178 x 81 cm). This variant of the game is described in the Europe 1940 manual as Axis & Allies Global 1940.

Integrates with:

    Axis & Allies Pacific 1940
61692.name: Axis & Allies Europe 1940

60800.description: Simple roll and move game running around a scoring track with characters from the Mickey Mouse Club.
60800.name: Mickey Mouse Club Game In Disneyland

61702.description: Memory game about the food pyramid. The players take turns trying to find matching pairs among the face-down tiles. When a pair is found, one of the tiles is put into the pyramid board and the player receives a hand token. If there is no space for it, the tile is discarded. In the end, the player with the highest number of hands and tiles in his/her own color in the pyramid is the winner.
61702.name: Besser-Esser: Die Ernährungspyramide
alternative_names: Bien se nourrir: La pyramide des aliments
Taste it all: the Food Pyramid
¡A comer bien!: La pirámide de alimentos

53512.description:
A version of Jungle Speed designed for younger, but always the same goal: Be the fastest to grab the totem and get rid of your cards!

Comes with a Scooby Doo totem, Bag, 72 cards, and 8 special cards
53512.name: Jungle Speed Scooby Doo

61710.description: The players are using tiles with one or two tubes to connect their side of the board with some tubes in the center of the board. Often, several players have to make use of the same tiles to get through.
61710.name: Aqua

61712.description: Up to four wooden hedgehogs (without any spines at the beginning) are running around a circular track. The movement is determined by dice (1-3 squares onwards), which could also show a color symbol. In that case, a spine in that color can be added to the hedgehog; the same happens when a hedgehog reaches a color square. When hedgehogs meet or a hedgehog symbol is rolled, the active player can exchange a spine with another hedgehog (some limitations apply). When a hedgehog has been filled up with all spines in its color and reaches a square in that color, the player who owns it is the winner.
61712.name: Auf, auf zum Stachel-Lauf

61713.description:
The object of the game is for your band (each player represents a band and there may be 2-6 players) to reach the No. 1 position on the Album Chart.

The board is divided into three separate circuits:
(1) On the first, the square outside circuit, your band is "On The Road".
(2) When you release a single you proceed (using your token) down the "tone arm" to the 7" track, i.e. the innermost circuit, called the "Single Track".
(3) Once your band has sold sufficient singles (150,000), you may release a record album and immediately proceed to the 12" L.P. track, called the "Album Track" (i.e. the larger circular circuit), simultaneously entering the Album Chart at position No. 100.

The Winner of the game is the first band to reach the No. 1 position on the Album Chart.
61713.name: So You Want to be a Rockstar

61714.description:
Introduction

In Conceptualize This! you're approached by two manufacturers of final products. They both want to launch a new product into the market, for which they need the same intermediate product. Step by step you conceptualize this intermediate product by collecting the right cards and placing them on the board. Be careful though, because every player is approached by different manufacturers and will do everything to get control over the intermediate product, which appears on the board.

Explanation

Conceptualize This! is a card game in which every player gets a unique target. During the game you try to collect cards which "connect" to each other in a dominos like way. The set of cards you collect results in a concept of the intermediate product, build up out of different components that need each other to function. The board supports the concept of tile (card) placement in such a way that the connections between the cards are made visible. The game is won by the player who completes his / her concept of the intermediate product on the board.

Background

The development on this board game started as an element of a Bachelor thesis. For the research in this thesis the board game was meant to educate people on how to model UML activity diagrams (a diagram in which the necessities and results of a series of actions are modelled) in a fast and easy way. During the creation of the board game the accent moved to a system diagram (a diagram in which the necessities and results of a series of components are modelled) which gave more freedom in the creation of cards. Because the concepts used in both modelling languages are the same, people should still be able to create an activity diagram after playing the game.

At first the game seemed to have a very high luck rate, but closer to completion the game turned out to be tactical as well. Due to this development a few extra rules were included which made the game even more tactical and increased the replay value.

The research on the Bachelor thesis for which this board game is created is still in progress. The board game itself however is completed and only needs to be stylised. If a publisher can be found the game will be published in the future. Currently both Dutch and English versions can be previewed by publishers.
61714.name: Conceptualize This!

61715.description: Expansion für Carambole. The expansion contains 15 numbered disks. The players try to sink the 1 or 15 first, then go up or down from there. The first player to sink the 8 is the winner (or the loser, if it wasn't that disk's turn yet).
61715.name: Die verflixte 8

61716.description: Expansion for Carambole. It consists of 19 disks which are black on one, white on the other side. The aim is to sink three own disks in a row when there are more of the opponent's disks on the board. When unsuccessful, any disks sunk so far are placed on the board again, opponent's side up.
61716.name: La Nuit du Carambole

53526.description:
From the back of the box:

ABC's Monday Night Football Game

For over 25 years, ABC's Monday Night Football has brought you the most talked about action-packed football games of each season.  Now you can pass, run and play defense along with your team in this fast-paced football dice game.  It is a game of strategy and luck - each player trying to outwit their opponent just like the pros.  Keep track of the plays up and down the field on the full colour football field game board.  Includes everything needed to play.

Includes:

6 Special Dice
Football Field Game Board
Non-toxic Erasable Marking Pen
Rules
53526.name: Sports Dice: Football

61720.description: Interactive game, with DVD and board with 5 thmemes and 5 kinds of proof: memory, speed math, spatial vision, emotional intelligence or scientific knowledge
61720.name: El Gran juego de Flipy de El Hormiguero

61721.description:
This is a beautiful children's game with a board that features a large "pop-up" 3-D castle. The board folds up to create the appearance of a medieval storybook.

Includes two playing pieces with plastic stands. They represent Cinderella as a lowly servant and Cinderella as a magical princess. There are also 13 memory tokens, a spinner, and the instructions. The tokens represent elements of the story like the Fairy Godmother.

Watch out for the wicked stepmother! The game ends when Cinderella meets the prince.
61721.name: Cinderella Storybook Princess Pop-Up 3-D Game

61722.description:
Mahjong Poker is a banking game developed for use in casinos.
This game consists of a special 82-card deck with artwork similar to that of Mahjong. The deck contains a joker and 3 suits, In each suit the cards are numbered from A to 9, with 3 identical cards for each number.
Each player is dealt a hand of cards and uses these together with the community cards dealt by the house to try to form certain combinations.
61722.name: Mahjong Poker

61723.description:
A trivia game about the Roman history.

Contents
144 cards
40 white counters
10 red counters
38-page answer book
Instructions
61723.name: The Interrogatory Game of Roman History

61724.description:
Game consisting of 80 cards. 36 cards represent monarchs. These show a woodcut portrait in an octagonal frame, and list numerous facts such as dates, names of parents and spouses, major events and people of their reign, and manner of death. 43 represent nobility close to the crown, and list facts without portraits. The 80th card gives the rules of the game, which is intended to teach English history.
Who could forget that Henry II died of vexation, John, Duke of Bedford, of mortification and anxiety, or Henry I of eating lampreys?.
61724.name: The Game of English Blood Royal

61726.description:
The winner of this eccentric trickster is awarded one or more Golden Geese. Agree beforehand what one Golden Goose is worth.

Always played at three Gooseberry Fool is a trick taking game where the winner is always the odd man out. When playing cards of the same suit (which is required if possible) the middle card wins, when two suits are played, the odd one wins and if multiple suits are played, the one with the odd color takes the trick.

Yet points are scored based on tricks won, where you get 1 point for each trick you win, yet 2 for each trick won by the player on your right. Also, the goal is to be the one in the middle when one player reaches 100 points. Thus at the end if the scores are 100, 82, 67; the player with 82 would be declared the winner (in case of a tie, the untied player wins).
61726.name: Gooseberry Fool

61731.description:
Operation Orient was a relatively obscure plan conceived by Adolph Hitler and Hiroshi Oshima, Japanese ambassador to Nazi Germany, that set forth a unified strategy for the two great Axis powers.  It called for the seizure of ports at Ceylon (now Sri Lanka) and Diego Suarez, Madagascar to disrupt Allied operations across the Suez Canal and Indian Ocean.  There were plans to invade Siberia in concert with the climax of the Wehrmacht's Operation Typhoon.  In it's most ambitious form, it proposed a land invasion of India by the Imperial Japanese Army, with great assistence from Subhas Chandra Bose and the Indian National Army.  Meanwhile German forces would seize Egypt and the Caucusus but not stop until panzers could parade in front of the Taj Mahal!  In the end, Yamamoto and the Imperial Japanese Navy won the internal power struggle - the American Pacific fleet and Allied colonies in Asia became the target of the Rising Sun and Operation Orient became just a footnote in history books.  But what if Yamamoto didn't have his way?  One can only imagine the frightful threat of a truly coordinated Axis effort.  Now you have the chance to rewrite history!

Operation Orient is a grand strategic simulation, currently in pre-production, that recreates the Pacific Theater of Operations during the Second World War.  It can be played as a standalone game or serve as an expansion to Sturm Europa! to create a truly global conflict.  The combined campaign game is a five player game, that will introduce a unique arrangement of sides, each with independent victory objectives and only ONE winner, to realistically depict the international and interservice rivalries that threatened to shatter the fragile alliances of all the major combatants of World War II.

PTO Only
Player 1 - Japan (Imperial Japanese Navy, Imperial Japanese Army)
Player 2 - Allies (United States Navy, Commonwealth Nations)

ETO + PTO (Requires Sturm Europa!)
Player 1 - Land Axis (Germany, Imperial Japanese Army)
Player 2 - Naval Axis (Italy, Imperial Japanese Navy)
Player 3 - ETO Western Allies (United States Army, Great Britain)
Player 4 - PTO Western Allies (United States Navy, Commonwealth Nations)
Player 5 - Soviets

Can be combined with Sturm Europa!
61731.name: Operation Orient

61739.description:
The first battle pack, The Skavenblight Threat, saw the emergence of the diseased and squabbling Skaven. The second battle pack, The Path of the Zealot, brought new forces for the Skaven and the witch hunters... and the third, Tooth and Claw, brought forth new heroes to battle the growing rat menace. Now, Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of the fourth battle pack for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, The Deathmaster’s Dance!

The forces of Order have put up a valiant fight against the relentless spread of the Skaven, but now a new threat has arisen, a threat that goes by name of Deathmaster Sniktch...

The Deathmaster’s Dance is the fourth monthly Battle Pack installment of The Corruption Cycle, the first linked expansion series for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, a card game of intense warfare, clever kingdom management, and epic questing. This 40 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame!
61739.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Deathmaster's Dance
alternative_names: Warhammer: Invasion – La danse du Maître Assassin
Warhammer: Invasión – La Danza del Señor de la Muerte
Warhammer: Invasion – La Danza del Signore della Morte

53557.description:
Colorio starts with players using plastic tokens to cover the colored spaces on the 5x5 game board. On each turn, a player must remove three tokens from the board, then either remove all of them from play or place one or two of them back on the game board in spaces different from where they came. (Thus, at least one token is removed from the board each turn.) A player cannot remove the final token handled by the previous player.

If a player reveals the fifth space of a color, that player is eliminated from the game. In a two-player game, the remaining player wins. In a game with more players, the game continues with that color (and that player) being out of play; when the fifth space of another color is revealed, that player is also out of the game. Plays continues until one player remains in the game.
53557.name: Colorio

53587.description:
This game is aimed at recreating the events celebrated in The Quintana, held in Ascoli Piceno in Le Marche, Italy on the first Sunday in August.  This pageant remembers the political in-fighting that raged in the town during the early Renaissance.

Up to 6 factions struggle to provide the best jouster to claim the rights as the top faction for the coming year.

This is a roll and move game where you have to occasionally answer trivia questions about the Quintana.  There isn't much for gamers here but, for those who've seen the Qunitana, it is an evocative rendition of the events in game form with all the components coloured according to the flags of the 6 factions.
53587.name: The Quintana Game
alternative_names: Il Gioco della Quintana di Ascoli Piceno

families: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
53588.description:
New Squadron pack for the Wings of War series set in second world war. Two biplanes that fought on all European and African fronts are featured: the Gloster Gladiator (in Mk. I, Mk. II and Sea Gladiator variants) and the Fiat Cr.42 Falco. From Belgium to Finland, from Hungary to Norway, many nations started the war with these beautiful and agile machines. Even Chinese Gladiators are included in the set, to reenact air duels over Asia even before WW2 started.

It contains 28 airplane cards and 2 'L' Maneuver Decks.

Part of the Wings of War series.
53588.name: Wings of War: The Last Biplanes Squadron Pack

expands.name: Wings of War: Fire from the Sky
Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II

60817.description:
A torero and a bull are fighting in an arena. The bull wins if it can run into the flag (which represents the torero) from behind, the torero wins if the bull runs into the flag from the side.
The bull can move 5 squares; the torero only one. The squares on the board have colors though, some colors restrict the movements.
60817.name: Torero

53621.description:
"The Oitavos game rules and play draw their inspiration from the actual history and architecture of the Fort of São Jorge de Oitavos. However they were not intended to replicate them exactly. We have created a version that allows everyone to participate in make believe history, and to learn even more about Cascais. Since this is a game, the main goal always is to have fun. The game celebrates the magnificent heritage of the town of Cascais.

The game is for 2 to 6 players who play the role of pirates trying to land and capture the greatest number of barrels of supplies. For age 8 and up. 40 to 60 minute game time."
53621.name: Oitavos

families: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series
53624.description:
Empires in America is a States of Siege(TM) series game on the French and Indian War (1754-62) created by veteran designer, Joe Miranda. With riveting solitaire gameplay action, you must command the beleaguered colony of New France, from Halifax to the Ohio Valley, while Britain and her American colonies press in from all sides with war raging from the fortress of Quebec to the Monongahela.

Employing Leaders to command the opposing Armies, Empires in America presents a new focus on the important historical personages of this era like Montcalm, Wolfe and even a young George Washington. These Leaders establish their reputations as their fortunes wax and wane on campaign across the far-flung frontiers of colonial North America.

Can the Montreal Militia and Algonquin Indians defeat General Braddock’s redcoats before they reach Fort Duquesne?  Can your Troupes de la Marine stop Rogers’ Rangers at Fort Ticonderoga? Will the Royal Navy sail up the St. Lawrence River to support operations against Quebec? Can court intrigue at Versailles undermine the machinations of William Pitt (the Elder)? Find out as you defend Montreal in Empires in America.

Game Components:
> One 8-page, color Game Rules booklet
> 40 color, die-cut 5/8" mounted two-sided game pieces
> 12 color, die-cut 3/4" mounted game pieces
> 48 ‘Historique’ Event and History cards
> One 11" x 17" color game map

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one British Army, each Leader commands several Battalions
53624.name: Empires in America
alternative_names: Empires aux Amériques: La Guerre Franco-Indienne, 1754-62
Empires in America: The French and Indian War, 1754-62

53630.description:
In The Puzzling Pyramid, each player builds a maze on the side of a pyramid for another to navigate, sight unseen. They then race each other to the top, turn by turn.

Four triangular pyramid faces sit atop a base. On the reverse of a player's pyramid face, you build a maze by placing a number of baffles between posts (at least one route must be provided, and handicapping can be achieved by limiting a player's number of baffles). The pyramid is then rotated a quarter turn so that each player faces a different side of the pyramid. On a player's turn, you use a magnetic wand on the surface to move a steel ball up through the maze on the back, toward the top of the pyramid. If the ball encounters a baffle, it's separated from the wand and drops to the bottom of the base. If a player is unsuccessful, the turn passes until on a subsequent turn someone successfully navigates to the top.
53630.name: The Puzzling Pyramid

53631.description:
The goal of game is to get to the castle. In this castle there the treasury is hidden. During your journey you will meet fairy characters and these characters will have some influence to your advance. Characters are printed on cards. 
Content:1 game board
20 pieces of fairy characters
20 stools
1 dice
CZ and SK instructions
53631.name: Z pohádky do pohádky

53634.description: Once upon a time bunny makes up his mind that he invites his friends for a visit. Who finds the most carrots is the winner. Game practices memory, attention and patience.
53634.name: Chytry Zajicek

53636.description: Board game with words for children. Words you create as in crossword. For the youngest there is board game with pictures, for older children there is classical board game.
53636.name: Kris Kros Pro Deti

53638.description: Game is dedicated to small children who are just discovering the alphabet. Game contents board game with illustrations of favourite the Little Mole and his friends. Children complete simple words with firing letters onto preprinted boxes. By the firing the last letter of the word gets player chip as a point. Who has got the most points is the winner. Game practice memory, thinking, lexicon, language skills and patience.
53638.name: The Little Mole and Letters

53684.description: Early 1940's card game featuring the comic strip legends.  The cards feature full color cartoon scenes from the Blondie comic strip.
53684.name: Blondie Playing Card Game

53685.description: Late 1930's card game featuring the fictional Chinese-American detective
53685.name: Charlie Chan Card Game

53686.description: 1940's card game of Flag identification and matching.
53686.name: Liberty Flag Game

53687.description: A food premium game issued by Post Toasties.  Simple spin and move game taking you around a track that features Mickey.
53687.name: Mickey Mouse's Treasure Hunt

53688.description: As the name implies - this is a Word game played by rolling cubes and spelling words.
53688.name: Steve Allen's Qubila

53689.description:
"The Snap-up Game of Lively Jumps"

1930's dexterity game of flicking jacks into containers mounted on a pole.
53689.name: Tiddle Tower

53690.description: Educational, easy to play game that featured some cool mini cars.  The game is a simple spin and move around the track style of game. Game features Chevrolet, Aston Matin, Bentley and Van Wall brand cars.
53690.name: Tollroad Turnpike

53708.description:
An 11 card expansion to Chrononauts that adds timeline cards and patches for the years 2000 to 2008, and new characters that are affected by events in that time period.

Publisher Blurb:

Chrononauts is now more than ten years old, and it's showing its age. A lot has happened in the 21st century, but the TimeLine stops at 1999!

Introducing the Gore Years, an 11 card expansion for Chrononauts which extends the TimeLine from 2000 to 2008. The set includes 5 new TimeLine cards, 3 new Patches, and 3 new Characters who depend on this new strip of TimeLine.
53708.name: Chrononauts: The Gore Years

expansions.name: Der HeidelBÄR: Wald und Wiesen Edition

53723.description: "Der HeidelBÄR" was just released this year (20 Year Heidelberger anniversary) and is a party game where everybody uses word association to describe a word with a per, peer, bear in it. The word is replaced with a bear and you need to describe it for the others with only six words. but the first two words are always "This bear..." or "My bear...". So you actually only have four words and you are not allowed to use words which are in the word you have to guess.
53723.name: Der HeidelBÄR

53729.description:
From the back of the book:

The Northern Guard is the main armed force of the North and leading the fight against the Southern MILICIA. It is an integrated army ready to take on all comers and hand them a resounding defeat. The pride of the North, the Guard fields a devastating combination of Gears, armor and infantry, ideal for fighting in the deserts, forest and jungles of Terra Nova.
The Northern Guard Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the Guard and build their own Guard units. Northern Guard land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the Guard.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard squadron types, including 27 Gear squadrons, 3 strider squadrons, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Northern Guard regiment.
- Seven new Gear and tank variants unique to the Northern Guard.
- Full details on five famous regiment, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Each regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the Guard, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock Number: DP9-046
53729.name: Northern Guard Army List

53730.description:
From the back of the book:

MILICIA is an acronym which stands for MILitary Intervention/Counter-Insurgency Army. The Southern MILICIA recruits troops from all four Southern leagues; they are used to staff border outpost and perform counter-insurgency duty in the three vassal leagues. Most importantly, they spearhead the fighting against the South's enemies, taking the fight to protect their own across Terra Nova.
The Southern MILICIA Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the MILICIA and to buid their own MILICIA units. Southern land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the MILICIA.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard cadre types, including 27 Gear cadres, 3 strider cadres, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Southern MILICIA regiment.
- New Gear and tank variants unique to the Southern MILICIA.
- Full details on five famous regiments, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Ech regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the MILICIA, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock number: DP9-048.
53730.name: Southern Milicia Army List

53731.description:
From the back of the book:

The Battle of Two Towers tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new regiments, the Northern Guard's 77th Heavy Gear Regiment (The Screaming Banshees), and the MILICIA's 121st Gear Regiment (The Fortunate Ones), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-050.
53731.name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack One: Battle of Two Towers

53732.description:
From the back of the book:

The Shadow War tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new regiments, the 42nd Combined Company (Death Jesters) and the 68th Companie (Chasseurs d'Ombres), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-054.
53732.name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack Two: Shadow War

53733.description:
From the back of the book:

The Operation Sudden Fire tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new units, the 13th Northern Gear Regiment, Charlie Company (Death Knells) and the remnants of the MILICIA's 127th Regiment (Carrion Serpents), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-056.
53733.name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack Three: Operation Sudden Fire

53734.description:
Contains six 8.5x11" full-color counter sheets and a 16-page black and white booklet, with four tactical scenarios and game stats for 44 Terranovan combat vehicles.

Stock number: DP9-057.
53734.name: Heavy Gear Armor Pack Volume One: Tanks & Striders

53739.description:
Come and join Fredi and Batonator at the zoo.
Fredi and Batonator brought the inhabitants of the zoo eight sacks of masts that children had collected. Then they decided to find their old buddies Panda Bear and Marabou Bird. Let's see who's going to be the first to find Panda Bear and Marabou Bird!
You can start the journey by rolling 1 or 6 with the die.
It's the first game in the "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" set out of the four!
53739.name: Fredi Ja Batonaator Loomaias
alternative_names: Fredi And Batonator At The Zoo

53740.description:
On the nice sea expedition on the warm southern sea, Fredi happens to find small treasure - a pretty string of pearls and a beautiful ancient oil can from an old sunken shipwreck at the bottom of the sea. He is eager to tell his best friend Batonator about his find right away. But unfortunately Batonator had stayed basking on the palm island. The voyage to this faraway and secluded island is not easy. Compete with Fredi - the one who is the first to surprise Batonator with the treasure, will be the winner. 
Second game in the set "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" out of four.
53740.name: Fredi Mereseiklus

53741.description:
You and Batonator are invited to Fredi's birthday. You can start the journey from France or Holland! Be the first to get to the birthday party and win!
Third game in the set of "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" out of four!
53741.name: Palju Õnne, Fredi!

53742.description:
In this game you will be astronaut who will be the first in the Universe to reach the periphery of Galaxy at billions of light years where no one has ever been. Be there first and win, but be careful, there are a lot obstacles in your way! Be clever and smart!
Final fourth game in the set of "Fredi aj Batonaatori seiklused".
53742.name: Fredi ja Batonaator kosmoses

53745.description:
Pop-A-Word is a word-forming dice game, self-contained in the familiar Kohner Pop-O-Matic mechanism.

On a player's turn, the tray containing nine letter cubes is popped and jiggled until lying flat in the center. The player then makes the highest-scoring word possible from the letters showing face-up, the score being the total of the point values on the letters used in the word. Letters cannot be used multiple times unless showing on multiple faces, and a blank can be used for any letter, though that letter scores 0. Bonuses of an extra turn and extra points are earned for words of 6 to 9 letters. The game continues until a player reaches 200 points or some other agreed-upon total.

There is an alternate game where all players form his or her own word simultaneously from the same pop.
53745.name: Pop-A-Word

53748.description:
Twenty-four square tiles are to be placed in a 5x5 tray (the center square is not playable); a player is eliminated when the player cannot make legal move; the last player to move, wins.

Each tile is a 2x2 square array of one of three colors - each permutation, ignoring rotation, is represented once among the tiles.

The game can be played solitaire as a puzzle.
53748.name: Nitty Gritty

53749.description: Three new scenarios for Russia Besieged: Fall Blau (1942-1943), Zitadelle (1943-1944), and Downfall (1944-1945), plus a Turkey variant that explores the circumstances under which either Germany or Russia might have brought Turkey into the war on their side.
53749.name: Russia Besieged Expansion Kit

53750.description:
In this HABA game,each player tries to be the first to collect five apples. There is a special die with three different side:

    Green spot: Hide and apple under the table.
    Red Spot: Hide the Apple Witch.
    Magpie: Helps players to steal other players apple.




Choose a player and try to steal him an apple or the witch.
If this player doesn't have anything, you must give him an apple.
53750.name: Apfelhexe

53753.description:
An innovative card game that breaks the conventional pattern of numbers and alphabets. the new Linkage links up the color dots with its own unique game theory. The game is developed to suit players of different ages and at different levels.

The new Linkage brings fun and join to everyone. And the game "Links" up your relationship with your friends and your family. Try the new Linkage -- you will like it!

The game contain 108 cards (in 3 colors form 1 to 9 and 4 cards each), and 5 different games 
"Lucky Draw"
"Never - mind"
"Consective Linkage"
"Suvivor"
"Pairing & Linking"

The basic linking principle is that, two card can be link in two ways,
1- cards with same number but different color
2- cards with same color with continue number e.g. 1 and 2, 7 and 8
53753.name: The New Linkage

53755.description:
Where high culture and pop culture collide... on your game table. This is a table-top implementation of the Jellyvision's irreverent trivia game.

"Hosted" by wisecracking "Nate Shapiro", the game serves as a scorekeeper of dollar values won or lost answering sublimely-worded trivia questions. The game's hard-coded database tracks questions by code, dollar value, and correct answer. A question's code is entered, the question is read aloud by a player, and a sliding door reveals four multiple-choice answers. Players race to buzz in, either to answer or to "screw" an opponent by forcing the opponent to answer. The game reveals whether or not players answer correctly and adjusts scores accordingly. High score after ten questions wins.
53755.name: You Don't Know Jack

53759.description:
This game features a map of Europe across which players travel via train and sea.  They have a number of sea tickets, rail passes, and passports with which to complete the task.

Year published, 1920, is just a guess.
53759.name: En Route Game

53760.description:
Shan Tu is a combination of Halma and Checkers that features a three-cornered board made up of a grid of circles, each connected with up to six adjacent circles.  (The board could easily be drawn with hexagons instead of circles and lines.)  The game is meant for three players but can be played by two.  Its pieces (ten per player) begin in one corner and move to an opponent's starting corner to be crowned, then must move to one of three central circles in order to win the game.  The first player to get one king to the central circles wins.  Pieces, be they ordinary un-promoted pieces or Kings, may move in any direction and capture opposing pieces by jumping.  Kings have no advantage other than that they are required to win the game.

According to The International Society for Board Game Studies, Shan Tu dates back at least to an 1895 advertisement describing it as "A worthy successor to Gobang, Reversi, Halma and other favourites."
53760.name: Shantu

53764.description:
Raja, which is a baby elephant, is in a porcelain shop. He must be very careful not to break porcelain goods.
Some columns are place on the way of the elephant, with porcelain goods on them.
Players must try to avoid these columns while moving the elephant that has a trunk tree in his trunk.
Several difficulty levels are available.
53764.name: Hoppla Elefant!

53778.description:
From the back of the box:

The fast-flipping game of high-flying fun!

Flip, fall, fetch! Open the board and fill the pond.
Use the flipper and flip your frog in. Land on a piece and it's yours. Collect the most pieces to win!

Includes:
1 game board
26 board pieces
4 seesaw flippers
4 frog markers
instructions for 2 levels of play

Ages 4 and up
53778.name: Flippity Frogs

53782.description:
This is a short and free expansion for the Song of Blades and Heroes skirmish wargame. It uses chess pieces and a chess board (alternative rules are included for using chess pieces on standard Song of Blades and Heroes terrain).

Each player commands the usual named pieces in chess: 1 King, 1 Queen, 2 Bishops, 2 Knights, and 2 Rooks. Before the game begins, the player has the opportunity to swap out named pieces for pawns (at the rate of 2 pawns per piece exchanged). Each playing piece has it's own special rules (all contained in the Song of Blades and Heroes rulebook, no other expansion is necessary).

The aim of the game is to take out your opponent's King by killing him or making him flee the board. Although chess pieces and board are used, this is not a chess variant - it is Song of Blades and Heroes to use with your chess set. The pieces retain the character of their equivalent pieces in chess, within the SBH setting.

The idea of Song of Rooks and Pawns is to offer a gateway introduction to the Song of Blades and Heroes system.
53782.name: Song of Rooks and Pawns

53795.description:
English Description:
"Fight for the Stars" depends on its, first 1986 finnished predecessor "Space War". 
This Space Based Battle and Strategygame, let the Players send their Fleets in Epic Space Battles. But the Administration and Structuring of your Empire would be same important as Battletactics. Building new colonies, design Starships and Collecting new Benefits of Technology are only a Handfull of the Possibillities from the Game. Refight the epic Historical Battles of the "First Terra" and and determine the Future of the Earth und from their Allies as well as from their enemies....

"The first Scoutships returned from its long, adventurous journeys. They report of new, unexplored worlds. At the same time they also told, that outside, between the stars, the terrible Fury of the war is ruling the Stars. A young empire stands in the fight against five allies, with one another star realms. Both sides look for worlds, which they can exploit them either, or allied it to their Star Realms. Without the want of mankind they are thrown into the swirling maelstrom. Thus begins then for mankind the "FIGHT FOR THE STARS"...

Historical Scenarios:
A. "Against all odds"
B. "Cry for Freedom"
C. "Slavehunters"
D. "The burning Skies"
E. "Target: EARTH"
F. "The Hand of Faith..."
G. "The Two Crosses"
I. "Fight for the Earth"
H. "Dolchstoß..." (Knife impact?)
J. "Changing the Frontiers"
K. "Descent to Hell"
L. "Jump in the Fire"

The Time Scedule for the History, from 2051 up to 2200 will be added soon as possible...

German Description: Kampf um die Sterne beruht auf dem erstmals 1986 fertiggestellten Vorläufer Space War. Bei dem Weltraumkampf und Strategiespiel Schicken die Spieler Ihre Flotten in epische Weltraumschlachten. Doch der Aufbau und die Verwaltung eures Sternenreiches sollte euch ebenso beanspruchen wie die Kampftaktik. Kolonien gründen, Raumschiffe entwerfen und die Technologie weiterentwickeln sind nur wenige der vielen Möglichkeiten des Spiels. In epischen "historischen" Gefechten kann die Zukunft der Erde und ihrer Verbündeten bestimmt werden.

"Die ersten Scoutschiffe sind von ihren langen, abenteuerlichen Reisen zurückgekehrt. Sie berichten von neuen, unerforschten Welten. Gleichzeitig verbreiten sie auch die Kunde, daß draußen, zwischen den Sternen, die schreckliche Furie des Krieges tobt.

Ein junges Imperium steht im Kampf gegen fünf miteinander verbündete Sternenreiche. Beide Seiten suchen Welten die sie entweder ausbeuten oder zu Verbündeten machen können.

Ohne daß die Menschheit es wollte wird auch sie in den Strudel des Verderbens hineingerissen.

So beginnt dann für die Menschheit der

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE

A. Das Basisspiel

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE ist ein Spiel für maximal sieben Personen ab 12 Jahren. Ziel des Spieles ist es entweder, nach einer vorher ausgemachten Anzahl von Spielrunden, die meisten Sonnensysteme (Variante A) oder mehr als die Hälfte aller Welten dieses Sternensektors (Variante B), zu beherrschen.

Alternativ können die Szenarien der Hintergrundgeschichte gespielt werden. Näheres dazu im Anhang (E).

3. Die Szenarien

A. "Gegen jede Chance"
B. "Schrei nach Freiheit"
C. "Sklavenjäger"
D. "Der brennende Himmel"
E. "Ziel: ERDE"
F. "Die Hand des Schicksals..."
G. "Die zwei Kreuze"
I. "Kampf um die Erde"
H. "Dolchstoß..."
J. "Frontenwechsel"
K. "Abstieg zur Hölle"
L. "Sprung ins Feuer"

2. Zeittafel

2051
Fünf Sternenvölker beherschen den, die Erde umgebenden, Raumsektor. Sie herrschen durch ihre Wirtschaftsmacht und mit Waffengewalt. Eine einzige unterdrückte, ausgebeutete Welt wagt sich zu wiedersetzen. Ihre einzigen Raumschiffe sind kleine wendige Raumjäger. Ihr Kampf ist "Gegen jede Chance".

2052 - 2082
Ein "Schrei nach Freiheit" breitet sich über die Welten des Sektors aus. Eine unterdrückte Welt nach der anderen schließt sich den Rebellen an. Diese Welten gründen die Konföderation von Konquerein.

2061
Die fünf Sternenmächte gründen eine Allianz um gemeinsam gegen die Rebellen vorzugehen.

2097
nachdem mehr als 1.500.000 Menschen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführt worden sind wird endlich eine wirkliche Weltföderation gegründet. Beginn der Aufstellung einer Strategischen Raumflotte unter dem neugegründeten Strategischen Raumverteidigungskommando.

2098
Die "Sklavenjäger" fallen massiv ins Solarsystem ein. Die Terranische Raumflotte wird in erste verlustreiche Kämpfe verwickelt.

2111
Gründung des Interstellaren Terranischen Scoutdienstes (ISTS).

2113 
Das erste Terranische Scoutschiff, die Magellan, bricht zu ihrer langen Reise nach Barnards Stern auf.
Ihre Schwesterschiffe, die Columbus und die Vasco da Gama, brechen nur wenige Wochen später, nach Alpha Centauri und Proxima Centauri, auf.

2127 
Barnards Stern wird durch eine unbekannte Waffe zur Supernova. Die Magellan entkommt da sie von einem, Zeitfeld in die Vergangenheit geschleudert wird.

2131
Die Columbus kehrt als erstes Terranisches Scoutschif, von ihrer Reise zum Alpha Centauri, zurück.
Rückkehr der Magellan.

2137
Das erste Terranische Raumschiff mit Hyperraumantrieb, die Sindbad, startet zu ihrer abenteuerlichen Reise.

2159
Erster Angriff, durch eine Velkandrische Flotte, auf die Erde. Gleichzeitig erreicht die Plasmastoßdruckwelle der Barnardsstern Supernova die Erde. "Der brennende Himmel" wird zum Fanal einer neuen Epoche.

2160
Eine Velkandrische Flotte ist unterwegs das "Ziel ERDE" zu erobern. Die beinahe unverteidigte Erde wird erobert.

2161 
"Die Hand des Schicksals" führt Henry St. George, einen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführten Terraner nach Konquerein. Er wird vom Rat von Konquerein mit der Aufgabe betraut der Erde ein Bündnis anzutragen. Die legendäre siebte Flotte von Konquerein stößt zur Erde vor und befreit sie von den Vilarii. 
Unter der Führung von Henry St. George wird Terra zum Verbündeten von Konquerein. "Die zwei Kreuze" von Konquerein und der Erde kämpfen nun gemeinsam gegen die Allianz.

2176
Der "Dolchstoß" des 1. Lordadmirals beendet die Konföderation und hebt in blutigen Kämpfen das Imperium von Konquerein aus der Taufe.

2179
Von Henry St. George selbst vorbereitet wird durch den Scoutdienst die Terranische Revolution ausgelöst und der "Kampf um die Erde" beginnt.
Es kommt zum "Frontenwechsel" bei dem die Erde sich der Allianz anschließt.

2199
Die Völker sind des endlosen Krieges müde geworden. Die Allierten starten eine letzte Großoffensive um endlich den Sieg zu erringen. Es wird ein "Abstieg zur Hölle".

2200
Die Terranische Flotte startet einen letzten verzweifelten Angriff auf das Heimatsystem Konquerein. Die gesamten Streitkräfte der Allianz unternehmen mit allen Einheiten Ablenkungsangriffe entlang der ganzen Front. Es ist ein "Sprung ins Feuer" denn die Aussichten, der Terranischen Flotte, zu siegen scheinen unendlich gering. Doch die Terraner geben sich nicht geschlagen. Denn sie haben noch einen letzten Trumpf in der Hand...
53795.name: Kampf um die Sterne

53796.description:
English Description:
The Game is Made for up to 8 Players.
Quadratic Game Tiles represent the Landscape similar to Kings and Thins and other Games of this Kind. Villages, Cities, a Main City, Castle, mines and more are Markings of the Realms from the Players. But also Battles will be there. Knights and Heroes, Farmers and shepherds must be recruited, to steel your enemies Sheep... only with enough victim Lambs you can correct benevolent the Gods and shaping new Land... make magic rites and defeat the evil... maybe you can be victorius against your enemies or even the Mighty common Sheep demons... Collect Food and breed Sheeps... a structural buildiung Strateggame from a little other kind...

German Description: Das Spiel ist für bis zu 8 Spieler gedacht. viereckicke Geländeteile ähnlich wie bei Kings and Things oder siedler von Catan stellen die Landschaft dar. Auf dieser Landschaft haben die Spieler Ihre Reiche mit Dörfern, Städten, Burgen usw... Doch auch Kampf gibt es zu oft... Ritter und Helden Bauern und Hirten werden aufgeboten um dem Gegner die Schaafe zu stehlen... denn nur mit genügend Opferlämmern kannst du deine Götter gnädig stimmen und neues Land schaffen... Zauber wirken... und dem Bösen begegnen... ja sogar vielleicht die gemeinen Schaafsdämonen besiegen... Nahrung sammeln und Schaafe züchten... ein Aufbaustrategiespiel der etwas anderen Art...

No English Rules available at present time!
53796.name: Götter, Helden, Opferlämmer...

53804.description:
Cir*Kis is a abstract strategy game for the whole family. Players take turns placing one of their nine differently-shaped pieces on the beveled game board next to the last piece played.

The aim is to complete Circles and Stars to score points. Cir*Kis is easy to learn. Each new piece must touch the last piece played. You can get a free turn three different ways. If you get a free turn, you can place your piece touching any other piece. Scoring depends on who completed a shape and who controls the majority of the pieces in it.

Be the first player to score 40 points to win the game!
53804.name: Cir*Kis

53809.description:
Quatrix is a two-player game with old world qualities. If you like Backgammon, this game is for you. You must use your best strategies along with the luck of the dice in order to win!

Rings and discs are used in Quatrix. When a disc and a ring are combined, they form a PiP (piece inside piece). Squeezing the ring with the disc inside allows the player to move both pieces together. There are two sets of PiPs in each color, seven pips in each set, and two sets of dice.

All the playing pieces are set up as PiPs on the starting tracks. Players will separate their PiPs as the game progresses. The first player to get his or her pieces reassembled as PiPs across the finish line of the same color wins the game.

Rings, discs, and PiPs can mose horizontally and vertically backwards and forwards, but never diagonally. Pieces can jump rings and discs, but you may not jump over a PiP of the opposing color. The board is 7 squares wide by 11 squares long, and has a starting track on each end, and a finish line on the opposite side of the board six tracks away.

(From the instructions)
53809.name: Quatrix

53832.description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

"This is a travel game I created after many trips with my nieces and members of our youth group. Simply roll the colored die. Match the color rolled on the die to the color on the chart and begin your search! Whoever finds the correct number of items first wins the round. Don't forget to shout "Score!" as you spot items along the road."

Laminated 3-1/2 x 5-3/4 card printed with the color-coded chart indicating the items you're looking for (ex: 4 yellow cars) and two scoring tracks. Comes in a ziplock with 2 tiny clothes pins to track your score on the scoring track and a custom D6.
53832.name: SCORE!

53834.description:
Published in Issue #11 of Dork Tower

From the rules intro:

"In World of Dorkness, you play one of the Goths of Mud Bay. It's Saturday Night, and you've decided to prove that you're the Alpha Goth by collecting the perfect clique and bringing it to Club Succubus, the Alternative Club. The only trouble is that the Goths of Mud Bay are scattered all over town, and fickle, and collecting the clique will be a tough job."

You'll need the board (included in the comic), a pawn for each player and 24D10 (6 each in 4 different colors or patterns).
53834.name: World of Dorkness

53840.description:
INTRODUCTION 
You gather in the main hall inside the Castle of Light. You can see clearly there is a deep sadness in the Great Elder’s eyes," As you already know that Elzoof has put a curse on this island so noone can leave. When you go travel south, somehow you will emerge on the north ! Meanwhile, he send his Minions called the Shadows to hunt any heroes-wannabe". The very old man takes a deep breath, "He stays in the Tower of Death and challenge anyone who wants to defeat him, or he will claim the throne very soon. With the loss of our great King in the Great War, no one dares to challenge him".
“With chaos and Shadows everywhere it won’t be easy. I will give each of you a magical Ring powered with the legendary amulet, the Amulet of D’Eugor. This Ring will protect you from lethal wounds, and you can use your power through this Ring to control Events anywhere in this Island."
The Great Elder pauses for two seconds, then he says, "May God be with you" .

 THE MISSION 
Enter the Tower of Death and defeat Elzoof !
53840.name: Adventure of D

53863.description:
From the introduction:

This introductory game contains a basic version of the Heavy Gear tabletop rules that is easy to learn and fast to play. It does not require the use of the rulebook or any of the older Heavy Gear supplements. The Heavy Gear Demo Game includes ten cut-out Gear counters, one color arena map and a condensed version of the tactical rules. All you need is pen, paper and a few six-sided dice!

Stock number: DP9-100
ISBN-13: 9781894814096
53863.name: Heavy Gear Demo Game

53866.description:
This demo game, printed on a folded single sheet of paper, contains the game basic rules, an introduction to the setting, cut-out counters, rulers and data-sheets for the following vehicles: Pathfinder, Lancer, Syreen, Wraith.

Stock number: DP9-300
ISBN-13: 9781894814102
53866.name: Lightning Strike Demo Game

53867.description: This demo game, printed on a folded single sheet of paper, contains the game basic rules, a game map, cut-out counters, rulers and data-sheets for American and German infantry and vehicles (M11A3 General Early and PzKpf V Ausf 'B' Valkurie).
53867.name: Gear Krieg Demo Game

53888.description: This fun action game is great for children 3 plus. Bob's toolbox spins around opening and closing as it goes and the players have to flick all of their coloured tools into the box first to be the winner. Be quick though as the tricky little toolbox keeps throwing them back out! Great fun for upto 4 people.
53888.name: Bob the Builder: Tricky Tool Box
alternative_names: Bob der Baumeister: Bob's verrückter Werkzeugkasten

53932.description:
Choose a Disney-mat and stand on it. Wait until the dice are thrown and hear what is being called. For example: Goofy says "stand on one leg". If you are on the Goofy-mat, you must complete this mission within 5 seconds, otherwise you are off. Players now doing same, but not on the right figure? Too bad, you are also off. Change of mat will occur occasionally and be aware if somebody throws Mickey..
The last player remaining wins the game.

Age: from 3 years

Contents: 
- 6 Disney mats 
- 2 special dice 
- Rules
53932.name: Stip Stap

53953.description:
For ages the vile Doom Knights have sought to gather the remaining Thunderstones to fulfill a prophecy of corruption over the lands. Now the first Thunderstone has been discovered in the Dungeons of Grimhold and the Doom Knights have sent their minions to claim the relic. The Villagers of Barrowsdale gather brave souls to face the dungeon and keep the Thunderstone out of the hands of the Doom Knights.

Thunderstone is a fantasy deck-building game much in the style of Dominion. Before the game starts a selection of Village and Hero cards will be randomnly chosen that players may add to their specific decks. Like Dominion, every player starts with a basic deck of weaker cards that they can use to purchase other more powerful cards. In Thunderstone these cards may be different Heroes such as mages, archers, thieves, or warriors or they may be supplies the heroes need like weapons, rations, or light to reach further into the dungeon.

A dungeon deck is also created by combining several different groups of monsters together. Certain groups of monsters may be more or less susceptible to different Hero types so players will have to take this into account when they choose what to buy.

Rather than buying puny Victory Points, player's will use their deck to defeat monsters in the dungeon. From the monster deck a row of cards is laid out. Players may on their turn choose to attack a monster in the deck rather than visit town and buy cards. If they do this they play cards from their hand and resolve their abilities in order to boost strength and have enough light to reach a specific monster. Some monsters also have special abilities which may hinder the player. If they have enough strength they defeat the monster and place that card in their deck. This card is worth victory points and often can be used as money to purchase other cards. In addition to this players are awarded experience points for defeating monsters which can be used to upgrade their heroes into more powerful versions. The game is played until the Thunderstone is revealed from the dungeon and a player is able to claim it. The player with the most victory points in their deck is the winner.

The basic Thunderstone framework was updated in the implementation of Thunderstone: Advance.

Integrates with


    Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin
    Thunderstone: Dragonspire
    Thunderstone: Starter Set
53953.name: Thunderstone

53966.description: Players move their tokens around a board decorated with Hershey's candies in an effort to collect enough candies to win the game. No decision-making is involved.
53966.name: Hershey's Kisses Counting Game

60878.description: Beagles, Labradors, and Pugs! Oh my! Pedigree Muster: Canine, a family-friendly card game, has dog lovers wagging their tails. With 15 different breeds in each of the 7 AKC categories (Herding, Hound, Sporting, Terrier, Toy, Non-Sporting, and Working), 105 different dogs means there’s a wet nose for everyone. Kids and adults alike will fall head over paws to collect as many dogs in the same group as they can. The one who empties their hand of cards first becomes the leader of the pack. With five different types of Action cards, there are plenty of ways to complicate your opponents’ game plans. But beware! They just might retaliate by biting back, twisting your schemes right back into your own lap. Shuffle your way to a barking good time! A flexible card game for 2-6 players, ages 6 to adult.
60878.name: Pedigree Muster: Canine

53993.description: Similar to standard bingo except each person picks one of the words from their board and has to relate a story or give advice to the mother to be. The bingo game is actually one of several games that come in the box. Other games include "Guess the waistline of the mother to be", where the mother stands in the middle of the room and everyone guesses her waist in inches. "Last woman standing" where the women receive chips with baby shower related words and every time someone says their own word by accident they lose a chip. Last woman to have a chip wins.
53993.name: Baby's Coming Bingo

53994.description:
Aerial Combat in the Mediterranean Theater, 1940-1943.

Blue Sea / Blue Sky is a collection of scenarios, campaign systems, aircraft data cards and new rules for use with the Red Sun/Blue Sky miniature games. This book recreates tactical aerial combat in the Mediterranean Theater in WW II, from 1940 - 1943, and includes stats for 10 Allied, and 32 Axis aircraft. Four solitaire scenarios, eight standard scenarios, and a mini-campaign included with the rules.
53994.name: Blue Sea / Blue Sky

54037.description:
What did all those laborers of the great Egyptian monuments do with their time off?  Just like us, they played games!

This exciting dice game is a race to the best score.  Will the ancient Atum bless you with many Scarabs or will you be plagued by the Scorpions of Hedetet?

Players roll the dice trying for special scoring combinations, but, just when you think you have a good score, another player rolls the Scorpion die!  Will you be Stung?
54037.name: Scarabs & Scorpions

54042.description:
2 players take turns placing tools onto Bob's wheelbarrow.  Eventually Bob decides he's had enough and will tip the lot onto the floor or earlier if the players are heavy handed. The player who causes it to fall gets penalty points.  The player with the least penalty points at the end of the game is the winner.

The game features a nice plastic model of Bob that holds the wheel barrow in place for children to place the tools. The wheel barrow itself features a mechanism that when triggered tips the barrow up and tools out.  Very much like Buckaroo!.
54042.name: Bob the Builder: Barrow Up Bob!

54043.description:
Jaipur, capital of Rajasthan. You are one of the two most powerful traders in the city.

But that's not enough for you, because only the merchant with two Seals of Excellence will have the privilege of being invited to the Maharaja's court.

You are therefore going to have to do better than your direct competitor by buying, exchanging and selling at better prices, all while keeping an eye on both your camel herds.

A card game for two seasoned traders!

When it's your turn, you can either take or sell cards.

If you take cards, you have to choose between taking all the camels, taking 1 card from the market or swapping 2 to 5 cards between the market and your cards.

If you sell cards, you get to sell only one type of good per turn, and you get as many chips from that good as you sold cards. The chips' values decrease as the game progresses, so you'd better hurry ! But, on the other hand, you get increasingly high rewards for selling 3, 4, or 5 cards of the same good at a time, so you'd better wait!

You can't sell camels, but they're paramount for trading and they're also worth a little something at the end of the round, enough sometimes to secure the win, so you have to use them smartly.

Jaipur is a fast-paced card game, a blend of tactics, risk and luck.
54043.name: Jaipur

54044.description:
"For generations human teens have crept into pastures at night and tipped over defenseless cows in their sleep.

"Last night they tipped the wrong cow... Elsa was the prettiest in the pasture, and Clyde the Bull was in love.

"Seeking revenge, this morning Clyde rushed onto a nearby highway, causing an auto accident and stopping traffic for miles. Now he's organizing gangs of cows from the pasture to tip cars off the road.

"Watch out world, it's the cows doing the tipping now!"

Collect gangs of cows by drawing cards from the draw pile or your neighbors' discard piles. Use these gangs to tip over the 5 types of vehicle cards in 5 different colors. Your score is based on the set of vehicle cards you tip; Busses are worth more than Cars and Trucks, but they also require a bigger gang to tip over. Motorcycles aren't worth as much, but they're easier to tip (require a smaller gang).

You score for collecting types of vehicles as well as for collecting colors, so you can go for a bunch of Tractors, or you could try to collect all the Blue vehicles.
54044.name: Cow Tipping

54046.description:
A card game simulating drivers in an apocalyptic future; where raiders and bandits roam the land, taking what they want by sheer force or through brute intimidation.  The players are wanderers; drivers of cars that have been modified to help them endure the perils “out there” as they travel the highways between fortified villages and settlements.

The game can be played by one or more players. Ideally, the game is intended to be played by “more” players but works fine as a solo game. In a multi-player game, the individuals can work together, or against each, or as teams if they have enough players.

The basic component is a standard deck of 52 cards, a token to show the drivers movement across the cards, and two 1d6 to keep track of the drivers two stats: health/speed.

Each player is trying to get his driver across a wasteland of broken roads, and marauding bandits.  The cards themselves are used as the road, modifiers during movement, and combat against marauders or other players.

The card suite and face value will determine the type and strength of encounters the driver will face along the road,  The driver will in turn use their hand of cards to control the speed of their vehicle as well as the strength of their attack and defense.   During a co-op game, the drivers can use their cards to help friendly drivers fight off marauders or control their driving reactions.


The game was designed as part of the Traditional Card Game design contest.

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/421774/page/1
54046.name: Road Rage: A card game

54055.description: 'Bobry' is a simple children's game. It has two variants. One of them - 'Swimmers race' - is a racing game. In the other one - 'Building beaver's lodge' - players collect tokens with elements depicted on them. The first player to collect four different elements of the construction wins the game.
54055.name: Bobry

54056.description:
Are you ready to lead your Legionnaires?!

According to the Gamealogical Institute History Department (wink, wink), this strategy game is derived from teaching methods used in the development of new Centurion Candidates in the far reaches of the north-west during the Late Roman empire.

Protect your flanks, master the use of the column and square formations and prove to the Training cadre that you are ready to lead.  This is a 2 player strategy game with very dynamic play; particularly as columns and square formations can break up and new ones be formed as you direct individual units on the battle field.

Tacticum includes multiple play setups known as "training scenarios".  Additional scenarios are added to the Gamealogical Institute website.

Tacticum Tournaments are being held at select game conventions in the Southeast
54056.name: Tacticum

families: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
54063.description:
Expansion for the 2008 release of Battlefields of Olympus.

Campaigns of Glory introduces Campaigns and Mythological Weapons to the battlefield. In addition, there will be more Land Trophies, Actions and Warrior cards.
54063.name: Battlefields of Olympus: Campaigns of Glory

54073.description:
Fish Stix is an strategy game where players match fish direction and color to score points. Each stick has 4 different fish on it and is added to others that have been played to score. The first player to score 10 points in all 6 fish categories, wins the game.

From the back of the box:

The game where every fish counts! Match fish row by row, the more you match the faster you go!

Fish Stix is a visual strategy game that takes just seconds to learn. Children of different ages will have fun playing together. A different game every time you play!

Includes:
72 fish sticks
4 scoreboards
24 fish tokens
instructions

Ages 6 and up

2009 Parents' Choice Gold Award
54073.name: Fish Stix

54079.description:
Object: To be the first player to get his/her gargoyle across the finish line.

Gameplay: Since the identity of gargoyles is hidden, you may be advancing another player's gargoyle. The game board includes SWITCH spaces, LOOK spaces, and LOOK 'N SWITCH spaces.

Box Contents: Board, 4 identical plastic gargoyle figures with different colored dots on bottom of base, 1 d6, instructions.
54079.name: Guess the Gargoyle

54083.description:
The simulation is designed for two players, one with a Muslim fleet and one with a Christian fleet.
Both players should be aware that although they primarily represent admirals with dreams of defeating the whole enemy fleet, they also represent subordinate officers who have personal objectives. They must allow for the wishes of individual captains to seek plunder on wrecked ships before their rivals get to it.
54083.name: Lepanto 1571

54084.description:
19 Oct – 26 Nov 1965
A conflict simulation reâenacting the battles of October and November 1965 in the Central Highlands of
Vietnam.

Plei Me is a two player simulation recreating the actions of the US 1st Cavalry Division (airmobile) in the Pleiku
province of South Vietnam during October and November 1965. The NVA B3 Front had an audacious plan to split
South Vietnam in two with a strike through the central highlands, if it wasn’t for the intervention of America’s latest
formation in airmobile warfare they could have very well succeeded. The Campaign had many varying types of force
on force engagement; sieges, ambushes, running battles and whole unit encirclements. The simulation is meant to
reflect the uncertainties in jungle fighting and the rapidly changing situations involved with airmobile operations.
54084.name: Plei Me 1965

54086.description:
This is a solitaire simulation of the Second Lebanon War 2006. The player represents the Israeli supreme political leadership (i.e. the Prime Minister and the War Cabinet) contested by the designed system, representing Hezbullah.

     The player’s aim is to defend his home-front from rockets fired at it by Hezbullah, and to maintain and improve his political conditions, domestically and internationally, towards the end of the game.
     The player must consider various factors that affects the campaign’s outcome: domestic and international political factors, military mobilisation and operational successes and losses.
     The player will keep good record of points on two designated tables: domestic political points and international political points. A third table will be used to keep track of turns. Each turn ends only after playing all phases.
     The initial setting of the simulation represents the first stage of the conflict. Therefore, the player has thirty-three days of war to simulate in eleven turns.
54086.name: Second Lebanon War: 2006

54087.description:
Afghanistan 1980 is a strategic simulation of the fight between the Mujahideen and the Armed Forces of the Soviet Union in the unforgiving mountainous terrain of Afghanistan.
The simulation begins in early 1980 after the initial occupation force of the 40th Army has been deployed.
54087.name: Afghanistan 1980

54113.description:
From the Inside Cover:

this is a set of variants and games based on Diplomacy, the popular game of international negotiation, intrigue, and warfare (voted Game of the Year in 1976 and 1977 by Games & Puzzles readers).  It is necessary to know how to play Diplomacy in order to use this booklet.  Many of the games also require use of a Diplomacy board and pieces.  Mapsheets are provided for others, but a set of pieces is still required.  In all cases all additional rules needed are included.  The games range from the abstract to World War II to "swords and sorcery", some for fewer than seven players.  They are arranged in a progressive instructive format to enable inexperienced players to learn simple variants first and more complex ones later.  There are also special sections on two - and three - player Diplomacy.

Table of Contents :

Part I Simple Variants
  Simple Variants using the Boxed Game Board
  1939 (World War II)*
  Colonization

Part II Moderate Variants
  Holy Roman Empire
  The Struggle for Hegemony in Europe, 1689-1815*

Part III Complex Variants
  1939 II*
  Realistic Variants
  The Song of the Night: Swords and Sorcery Diplomacy*

Part IV Miscellaneous 
  Two-Player Diplomacy
  Three-Player Diplomacy
  Compilation of Simple Variants

3 11x17 mapsheets are included


     uses separate Mapsheet
54113.name: Diplomacy Games and Variants

54124.description:
In the World of ChessCraft, there are 4 races. Each race represented by a different colour. Orc is Red, Undead is Black, Human is Blue and Elf is Green. Each has their own unique abilities to influence the game play. Orc has piece promotion and piece destruction. Undead has graveyard manipulation and piece control. Human has piece position and board manipulation. Elf has card manipulation. The battle has just began!
